page.title: 13KILWORTH'S FLOWER FESTIVAL
page.content: At intervals of about four years a flower festival is held in st. Andrew's Church,North Kilworth.The most recent of these events took place in 1985.They last for three days. The theme for that festival was "The Kingdom".The whole church was decorated with beautiful,intricate and cleverly conceived flower arrangements .Outside the Church was a flower decorated plough.The porch door was ringed with flowers,whilst inside, on the stone seats, were two "Well Dressing"boards,with texts in flower petals,made by the schoolchildren. Inside the church every window sill,pew end,corner and crevice held its arrangement.Hanging from the light fittings were flowers in picture frames.The Chancel was a riot of white and gold,with flowers climbing to the top of the East wndow.Â£900 was raised.
